projects.name: My First Webpage
projects.description: My first webpage I ever built. I used vanilla HTML, CSS & Javascript. My goal was to build a blocky themed webpage with a toggle for light/dark mode, and an picture carousel and embedded google map.

projects.name: My Second Webpage
projects.description: My second webpage, based on an Estate Agency's site (front-end). I used vanilla HTML, CSS & Javascript. My goal was to recreate the front main page design as close as possible to the original design. Responsiveness is poor and layout is inconsistent.

projects.name: Form Validation
projects.description: Form with validation (front-end). I used React with its useState, useRef hooks & Regular Expression to validate the entry of form data.

projects.name: Fullstack Portal
projects.description: The objective of this project is to build a FullStack web-portal. This web-portal will be able to handle multiple users login Events with secure authentication and authorization, achieved through the use of bcrypt and JWT. Data will be managed through the use of the MVC principles, using Mongoose & MongoDB for the data handling aspect of the project. React will be used for the Front-End, with axios handling endpoint requests.

challenges.name: Sunny Side Agency - WIP
challenges.description: This challenge was to build a front-end landing page based on the provided design, matching the build as close as possible to the provided design & be responsive to different screen sizes. Vanilla React was used with no extra dependencies.

challenges.name: Rock, Paper, Scissors - WIP
challenges.description: This challenge is to build out a Rock, Paper, Scissors game and get it looking as close to the original design as possible. Vanilla React was used for this challenge.

challenges.name: Space Tourism
challenges.description: This challenge is to build out a multi-page space tourism website and get it looking as close to the design as possible. I used React with useContext & useReducer to pass data from an internal JSON file to components. Components were styled with SASS, a CSS extension language.
